PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Efficient bandwidth utilisation of distributed load balancer using machine learning
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Load balancer is a device which distributes the load to servers on a data center. At Citrix, a distributed version of this load balancer is developed (Cluster). In few deployments, a lot of traffic is steered (exchanged) between the nodes of distributed system, this results in wastage of available bandwidth. I have come up with a Neural Network model that predicts the traffic distribution. Based on this we are taking intelligent decisions to reduce  traffic steering between nodes of a cluster.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Relation between NMF and frequent patterns
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: This project initially started to identify software clones and progressed towards establishing the relation between existing state of the art techniques in Date Mining namely NMF (non-negative matrix factorization)  and frequent patterns. It also established relation between K-means, K-mode clustering algorithms and NMF.

This is an initiative taken up with peer team (SDWAN) at Citrix.  SDWAN imposes user specified policies on the network traffic to prevent unfair bandwidth usage by a client/application. However, on encrypted traffic none of these policies can be applied (since data is encrypted, we cannot detect the properties of a flow). We have come up with a machine learning model that classifies the encrypted traffic in to set of predefined classes. Based on the class assigned, decisions are taken to ensure fair usage policies.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Hierarchical clustering of text documents for improving query results
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
This project emphasises on clustering of words in a document collection for obtaining better   
results for a query. This method produced good results for text queries on a document collection.
